meaningMnemonic: A <radical>loiter</radical>ing <radical>mountain</radical> <radical>king</radical> in the <radical>winter</radical> is an <kanji>indication</kanji> or <kanji>sign</kanji> of something to come.
readingMnemonic: When you spot a loitering mountain king in the winter, you know it's an <kanji>indication</kanji> that soon Mrs. <reading>Chou</reading> (ちょう) will appear. It's like a Groundhog's Day kind of situation, but instead it means Mrs. Chou is about to come out, perhaps early for the season.
